item.description:
Tibetan Healing Practices with KESHAV HOWE

Workshop participants will become acquainted with some ancient tradition Tibetan Shamanic healing techniques such as Pho-Wa (transference of consciousness) and Ch≈°d (the sacrifice of hindrances to spiritual awakening). Topics include soul retrieval; ecstatic release with the dead and dying; and the healing of others, self, the community, and the planet from the Tibetan tradition.

According to the Tibetan custom, in the event of someone dying, a member of the family of the dying person would request a Lama to perform the "phowa" ceremony (Transference of consciousness at the time of death). The Phowa practice is the most direct and the quickest path for one to achieve enlightenment. "There are teachings for one to become enlightened, but I have a teaching (Phowa) that offers enlightenment without meditation", said Marpa, the great translator and the father
of the Kagyu Lineage.

Sacred Rivers Yoga
Glastonbury CT
Time: 7 to 9 p.m.
Cost: $20 cash
item.name: Tibetan Healing Practices
